BiblioData.Title: METHOD OF PRODUCING MICROCHANNEL AND NANOCHANNEL ARTICLES
BiblioData.Abstract: A method of making an article having channels therethrough includes the steps of: providing a ductile structure defining at least one macro-channel, the macro-channel containing a salt; drawing the ductile structure in the axial direction of the at least one macro-channel to reduce diameter of the macro-channel; and contacting the salt with a solvent to dissolve the salt to produce an article having at least one microchannel.

Claims.P: 1. A method of making an article having channels therethrough comprising:
a. providing a ductile structure defining at least one macro-channel, said macro-channel containing a salt;
b. drawing said ductile structure in the axial direction of said at least one macro-channel to reduce diameter of said macro-channel; and
c. contacting said salt with a solvent to dissolve said salt to produce an article having at least one microchannel.
2. A method in accordance with claim 1 wherein said ductile structure comprises a glass composition.
3. A method in accordance with claim 1 wherein said salt is characterized by a melting temperature that is lower than a drawing temperature of said ductile structure.
4. A method in accordance with claim 1 wherein said salt is characterized by a melting temperature that is higher than a fusing temperature of said ductile structure.
5. A method of making an article having microchannels therethrough comprising:
a. providing a ductile structure defining at least one macro-channel therethrough;
b. depositing a salt composition into said at least one macro-channel;
c. heating said ductile structure to a sufficient temperature so that said ductile structure can be drawn and so that said salt melts;
d. drawing said ductile structure so that the diameters of said at least one macro-channel is reduced;
e. cooling said drawn ductile structure; and
f. contacting said salt with a solvent to dissolve said salt to produce an article having at least one microchannel.
6. A method in accordance with claim 5 wherein said ductile structure comprises a glass composition.
7. A method in accordance with claim 5 wherein said salt is characterized by a melting temperature that is lower than a drawing temperature of said ductile structure.
8. A method in accordance with claim 5 wherein said salt is characterized by a melting temperature that is higher than a fusing temperature of said ductile structure.
